author: Special Correspondent
text:
Employees of all nationalised banks other than the State Bank of India and Indian Overseas Bank in the district struck work on Friday in response to the one-day stir called by the All India Bank Employees’ Association.

The bank employees had been protesting the “anti-labour policies” of the State Bank of India and in support of their other demands.

Normal banking operations were hit because of the strike as part of which employees staged a demonstration here led by Tiruchi District Bank Employees’ Union general secretary G. Ramaraju.

The striking employees’ demands included de-linking associate banks from State Bank of India, withdrawal of the “draconian” career progression scheme from the associate banks, and settlement of all pending issues. They demanded immediate halt to moves for merger of associate banks with State Bank of India.
title: Bankstrike hits operations
